articles.title: FAA reducing air traffic by 10% across 40 ‘high-volume’ markets during government shutdown
articles.description:
Air traffic controllers have been working unpaid since the shutdown began Oct. 1, and most have been on duty six days a week while putting in mandatory overtime.

The post FAA reducing air traffic by 10% across 40 ‘high-volume’ markets during government shutdown appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: FAA to reduce air traffic by 10% in Boston due to government shutdown.
Air traffic controllers have been unpaid since October 1, working six days a week.
Travel disruptions expected for Boston residents as air traffic decreases in high-volume markets.
